intro: Kengyilia eremopyroides, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with deep roots to access groundwater. Kengyilia eremopyroides is often found in rocky soils and is a symbol of resilience in desert ecosystems.
